data_maturity_score.evidence: Uses modern cloud-native tools (AWS EMR, Glue, RedShift, Databricks) and Spark ecosystem, but no explicit mention of data governance, quality testing, or CI/CD practices

data_maturity_level.evidence: Matches score of 3 - documented processes with modern tools but limited governance signals

maturity_signals.evidence: Explicit mentions of AWS EMR, Glue, RedShift, Databricks, Spark, Kafka - indicating cloud-native modern stack adoption

scope_creep_score.evidence: Focused data engineering role with clear responsibilities around pipelines, Spark, and AWS - no conflation with data science, analytics, or DevOps

overtime_risk_score.evidence: IBM delivery center environment may imply client deadlines, but no explicit overtime or on-call mentions; onsite work in Pune suggests standard hours

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined responsibilities focused on data pipelines, Spark, AWS, and streaming - specific technologies and use cases mentioned

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low risk - clear role definition, no scope creep, moderate overtime risk, but no benefits or work-life balance signals

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: Mentions working in IBM Consulting Client Innovation Centers but no specific manager or reporting line mentioned

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager title or level mentioned in job description

team_growth_velocity.evidence: IBM is established company; no mention of team expansion or rapid growth - likely stable team size

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting structure specified in job description

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: IBM Consulting delivery center model typically implies centralized team serving multiple clients rather than embedded in product teams

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: IBM offers career growth potential, but no explicit learning budget, conferences, or career paths mentioned in job posting

tech_culture_score.evidence: Modern AWS/Spark stack indicates good technical culture, but no mention of engineering practices, code reviews, or innovation

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML tools mentioned in job description

hiring_urgency.evidence: No urgency signals like 'ASAP' or 'immediate start' mentioned

competition_level.evidence: IBM is well-known, Pune location has moderate competition, no salary disclosed which may reduce applications

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a well-established technology company with global presence and delivery centers

hiring_velocity.evidence: IBM regularly hires for delivery centers; no indication of aggressive expansion or replacement

team_size_signals.evidence: No team size mentioned in job description

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a publicly traded company with stable funding

strength_details: Strong AWS/Spark technology stack with Databricks, EMR, Glue, and RedShift
Clear data engineering focus with specific responsibilities around pipelines and streaming
IBM is an established, reputable company with global delivery centers
concern_details: Salary not disclosed - common for IBM but reduces transparency
No visa sponsorship mentioned - restricted to India residents only
Limited growth signals - no career path or learning opportunities mentioned
best_fit_details: Senior DEs with 5-8 years experience in AWS/Spark ecosystems
Engineers seeking stable enterprise environment with modern cloud technologies
probe_details: Ask about actual team size and seniority mix in the Pune delivery center
Inquire about career progression opportunities and technical leadership paths
Request salary range and benefits package details
leverage_details: 5-8 years experience with Spark/Python/Scala on AWS matches requirements exactly
Experience with streaming pipelines and Kafka is valuable for this role
summary.overall_assessment: Solid opportunity for senior data engineers seeking enterprise experience with modern AWS/Spark stack. IBM provides stability and global exposure, but lacks transparency on compensation and growth paths. Ideal for candidates in India with cloud data engineering expertise.
